name: Misty Campbell
text: Very pleased with Frank, Jamie, and all the great people at Belle Shain!!  I contacted Frank when I was about at my wit’s end with our puppy, Cross.  He was biting/chewing excessively (on me mostly), he was unable to walk on a leash, and he was just not doing well.  Within a matter of weeks, Frank and his team have taught Cross how to behave better, he has learned commands, and he is a more pleasant dog to be around.  I can tell Cross loves being at Belle Shain, too. He enjoys playing with other dogs, running around, and swimming in the river. Definitely helpful for training and burning off all of that puppy energy!

name: Annie Summers
text: I trained my two dogs Dixie and Maddie with Frank and Jamie at Belle Shain Kennels. It has made a huge difference in how much enjoyment I get from my dogs now they will sit, heel and place. I highly recommend their training facility. My dogs love it there. I still take my  them for kenneling when I travel and day care boarding too. Frank does tune ups on Saturdays at the Woof Bar, I think that’s more tuning up the trainer than the dog🐶. Great people and wonderful property for the dogs to play.

name: Stacey Bottorff
text:
Great training and boarding program! Our dog spent about 3 months with Frank working on general obedience and then progressing from there. He is very knowledgeable and patient, incorporating training sessions with my husband and I throughout the months as well. Our dog enjoyed her time there!
During her time there our dog also required some vet attention (preexisting issue) and Frank did not hesitate to get her into his vet for care. Would definitely recommend Frank and his training program to other dog owners!

name: Daniel Campbell
text: Frank and the gang at Belle Shain are nothing short of fantastic. They are very accommodating and do a great job at a very reasonable price. Our dog was young, very energetic, and rambunctious. They are successfully turning him into a much better mannered young dog. He gets lots of exercise and loves playing with other dogs and swimming in the river (under supervision). He is excited to jump out of the truck he gets there every Monday morning and is obviously very well treated at Belle Shain. I can not recommend them enough.

name: Chase Emerson
text:
Frank and his crew were outstanding!!
They had my dog trained very quickly, and efficiently.
Not to mention they treat all the animals very well. I will use them in the future over anyone else!!

name: Kyle Maxwell
text: Frank and his crew did an amazing job training my dog and treated her very well.

name: Chris Wade
text: No other place I would take my dogs. Frank did an awesome job with both of my dogs. Use him for boarding when we go out of town. Dogs have a blast and get excited when we pull in the driveway!

name: Abigail Jackson
text: Clipper has had a blast this summer at training and boarding camp. He has learned so much and is now off leash. I have seen a total transformation in Clipper’s behavior and attitude. Frank and Staff are amazing to work with and really get to know and care about your dog. I am forever thankful for BelleShain Kennels.

name: Desmond LeMesurier
text: We just got a dog a month ago and decided to visit here. It's a nice fenced open area with shaded areas for you to sit down on the picnic tables. The dogs have plenty of room to run around! They also have a secondary area that is smaller for you to contain your dog and leash your dog before leaving out the outside gate. There is a doggy water fountain near the entrance. It was a nice safe place to let him be free for a little while.

name: Amanda Kay Whiddon
text: Cute little dog park in Brewton, Al.  This dog park is nestled right in the middle of town and is very clean and is nicely segregated for large and small dogs having two separate areas.  There are no human bathrooms however.  Very basic but very clean!

name: john hulstrunk
text: Excellent park for dogs of all sizes and ages. Water available. Poop bags and garbage cans. Lots of shade.

name: James Spears
text: It's clean, peaceful, and has lots of room for the dogs to explore.

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Wonderful play groups and boarding. Great staff and always willing to give me reports no matter how many times I call to check up on the puppies. Highly recommend

name: Jennifer Horn
text:
CDT isn't our normal boarder, but i almost effed up Thanksgiving by forgetting to schedule Jackie to board. Creative Dog Training came through for us!

I couldn't believe they had room! And when we got there, they were SO NICE. Oh my gosh, i can't remember her name, but she was tiny & had dark hair like me. She was really able to make me feel confident about leaving him in their care.

Jack was having some hotspot issues, so she took his medicine & told me they keep a close eye on him. They also were able to put him in a play group for older dogs, which they posted pictures on Facebook every day! They also didn't care that I'm a helicopter dog mom & called every day to check. =)

I was so excited, i burst through the door at the facility & announced i was there to pick up my dog. (I also may have done a little dance.) The little girl from before said Jackie's name before i even got a chance to! They really know & care about their clients!

Also, when i picked him up, they'd been taking such great care of his hotspots, they were almost totally resolved!! =O

11/10 experience, will DEFINITELY board there again!

name: Keith M
text: Fantastic facility and knowledgeable staff.  They really work well with teaching us and especially our kids.  Can't say enough positive things about this place.  It's the only place to go for dog obedience.

name: Rebecca Whitaker
text: I took my dog here for a class lesson and Mrs. Margaret was absolutely wonderful. She made the lesson easy and fun for my children and has certainly made a difference in my dog. She has a way with training not only dogs, but owners too! I would recommend Creative to anyone!

name: Madison Mindler
text:
The absolute best place in town!! I have worked here since 2016 and can only say great things. We take care of every dog like they are our own and have absolutely nothing to hide. You can come in anytime for a tour, talk to a client advisor, trainer, or supervisor. Every person has a passion for dogs and a drive to make Cdt the absolute best. I can’t dream of a better job and watching clients go home happy with their pup
Is the best feeling ever!!

name: pitna kim
text: My dog loves to go CDT and he seems like too much fun every visit :)

name: Shades Creek Dental Patient Centered Care
text: I can not say enough about creative dog training! Our dog Sandy is always excited to go and play and comes home exhausted from all of the fun. The staff are clearly all animal lovers and take great care of your pets.  Also, if your pet needs any vet care, they work with a vet a couple doors down to take your pet back and forth for appointments! Thanks!

name: Amanda WR
text: They were nice enough at the counter but when we picked our dog up, her paws and legs were soaked in urine and she was filthy. Our backseat had to be professionally cleaned to get the smell out. I don't know how they let the dogs get like that, perhaps not cleaning the play area well. Anyway, I called them and left a voicemail about this and never heard back.

name: chris collins
text: Creative Dog Training is awesome. We bring our dog every Monday for continuing training and play time. He comes home smarter, tired, and happy as ever. We love our friends at Creative.

name: Lucy Phillips
text: Highly recommend Creative Dog Training! They have done a fabulous job training my Siberian Husky and she LOVES doggie daycare! She’s always exhausted when she gets home!

name: DeKayla Sankey
text: Very poor customer service. You have to consistently pester and call them, only to have them take down your name and number with a very empty promise to get back with you. THEY NEVER DO. I have been calling for a week straight and my problem still has not been resolved, but everytime I call they tell me how sorry they are. Tuh. I am a paying customer and feel very undervalued. I’ve been more than patient with them, but at this point I just want what I paid for, so I can be done with them. I will not be returning.

name: Everything Bham
text: The owner and staff really care about you and your animals!  Never have had a bad experience! One of the best family owned businesses in bham! I believe in Birmingham!!

name: Lori Goldberg
text:
Do NOT take your dogs here!
This place is not sanitary. The workers leave dogs in pee and poop filled kennels for hours before they are cleaned.
The dogs don't go outside from 4pm to 7am the next day.
They have had 2 cases of kennel cough since spring break, and have still been using the same sponge to clean all of the dog bowls.
If your dog is having a health issue while boarding, the workers will not tell you about it if they don't think it's serious. There are dogs who get incredibly sick either from stress or other health problems that result in blood in the vomit and/or stool. The only thing they do is take the dogs food and water away and don't let them outside.
The dogs water bowls are only checked at 7am and then again at 4pm. So your dog may be going without water for any number of hours between those times and the workers will ignore it. The bowls are only cleaned once per day, so if your dog is boarding for several days, there's a very good chance that they'll have the same bowl of water over the course of their stay. They have a major rat problem there, so often times there is rat feces in the water bowls.
The dogs are left alone all night with the rats, which your dogs could be eating over night, making them very sick and possibly catching diseases.
The workers do not have first aid training, so if your dog chokes on the mulch that is outside in the play area, then they are told to "look up an instructional video" to help the choking dog.
They don't pay attention to what the dogs are doing because they're too busy on their phones to care. So if your dog poops mulch (very bad for his digestive system) then it's because they were eating it from the play area. There are also several dogs who eat poop, so if your dog has that habit, it's probably only getting worse because they think they're allowed to do it while staying there.
When the dogs are playing outside, they are sometimes not given water for several hours due to certain dogs not liking the water hose.
I have witnessed a coworker giving the wrong dog her medicine. Once that realization was made, still nothing was done about it.
If your dog is not good with other dogs, they are set as "individuals" where they play by themselves. These dogs are only getting 10 minutes outside to play, and then they get 10 minutes inside to play. They are supposed to have another 10 minutes to play but are usually skipped because the workers want to go home early. So if your dog is boarding over the weekend and they're not good with other dogs, then they're only getting about 20 minutes of outside time every day while the other dogs get over 2 hours.
The weekend hours are different, so all of the play groups are shortened and the dogs are left alone for a lot longer than they normally would be.
Their medicine is put in pill pockets in their food. If the dog doesn't voluntarily eat the pill pockets, then that dog will not be getting their medicine that day.
The dogs only have access to their food for a couple hours a day. So if your dog is a grazer and doesn't eat all of their food at once then they will be eating very little over the course of their stay.
The kennels are painted very poorly, paint is always chipping off the walls, usually because dogs are chewing it off.
Workers regularly spray dogs in the face with Bitter Apple spray. This spray is supposed to be used for dogs that have problems chewing their fur, and is not meant to be sprayed in the eyes or nose of the dogs, but they are regularly sprayed in the face if they are barking in their kennels.
If you request for your dog to be given a bath, they will usually bathe the dogs very early in the day to get it out of the way. Once they're bathed, they are not allowed back outside and their food and water bowls are taken away. So if you dropped your dog off at 8am to be picked up around 5pm, there's a good chance that your dog hasn't been outside or had food or water since about 10am.

resp.text:
Hi Lori, I wanted to reply here as well since I did not hear back from you regarding this same review you left on Facebook.
I'm truly sorry this is how you felt about working at CDT.

As one of the owners, and the person responsible for systems management in the locations I am very upset to hear these things. I'm also very concerned that not once had myself or any of the owners been contacted or told any of these things throughout the course of your employment there.

Because I can assure you, that not one thing you have said is company policy or are reflective of our systems we've built over 40 years.

There's nothing I can say to refute your claims because you cannot prove a negative, all I can say is that if you truly felt this way you should have come directly to myself, Margaret or Damian the multiple times we are all there per day whether helping out, working on things or just leaving our own dogs there for boarding or daycare.

At the end of the day, I'm sorry you feel this way about CDT. We have been doing this for over 40 years at this point, and have thousands of satisfied clients and dogs that I would hope reflect otherwise. If you would like to talk further or share specifics please send me a message because I would like to know details so I can address anything possible.

name: Daryl Mote
text: I’m glad that I checked on here for reviews before scheduling. The owners responses on here to previous employees are very unprofessional, very telling, and honestly, a complete turn off. You ALMOST had my hard earned money.

name: Elliott Knight
text:
Stay far away from this place.

The dogs here are kept in very unsanitary conditions that resemble a prison.

The staff here do not get along and the management is even worse. Almost all of the staff quit in one day over horrible working conditions, unfair treatment, and unfair pay.

Do not apply to work here, and do not take your dog here.

name: Tamara Buckley
text: Experts!! Loving, caring, patient! Trustworthy, your puppy to your senior companion will be in excellent care.

name: Michael Morgan
text: Professional and friendly staff providing effective dog training.  Boarding. Day Care. Grooming.

name: Steve H
text: This place reeked of non-neutered dog pee. My wife could smell the odor on my clothes when I came home and I only took a brief tour.

name: Matthew Burford
text: Knowledgeable trainers at a decent price.  Levels of available training levels from puppies to mature adult pet.

name: Susan Halbrooks
text: My dog loves it and so do i

name: Jeremy Crook
text: Eye for an open market, professional, and an expert at what they do. Entrepreneurship at its finest in BHM!

name: Anusheel Gandhakwala
text: Its a good place for dog . But sending your dog for 2 hour and your pet will stinks for until you get him bath .

name: karen lovett
text: It was a good place but the inside kennel smell was horrible and starting pay was extremely low.

name: Jordan Estus
text: Great place with great people!!!! Highly recommended!

name: John Phillips
text: They treat me and my dogs like family

name: Gz
text: Dishonest business practices.

name: Hilary schulak
text: Fun place

name: M Be
text: The owner cares about people !! Rare these days

name: Dexter Boyd
text: Great business

name: Sam Cook
text: Dog park is nice with fenced in areas. Wish there was more shaded areas. Was also hoping to see other dogs and people there though, but it was empty.

name: Ben
text: This is a fantastic dog park with plenty of space and obstacles. There are two fenced sections (designated for dogs >/<35 lbs.) with access to water.

name: Rebecca Messenger
text: Nice dog park inside a city park.  Separate areas for large and small dogs.  My only complaint is the mud, but it's to be expected after the rain.

name: Daniel Morton
text: Great dog park, well maintained though there is a small problem with drainage in one section in the large dog area after rains.

name: Robyn Woodbury
text: The nicest and cleanest dog park we have ever visited.  It has grass, and obstacles and structures, and there is water and a doggie pool.  It was spotless, and well maintained.  Thank you to the staff and volunteers that take care of it!  There are separate areas for small and large dogs, and each section has a one-way entrance and exit.  It is well thought out.  Someone did a fantastic job in designing this dog park.  Just awesome!

name: Fernando G
text: Tell him dog park this mall dog park area is amazing people awesome there it's a little money sometimes without plant mark more grasses better absorbent

name: Shawn Price
text: Great little park. Area for big and small dogs. Parking is close and the walking path is dog friendly too

name: James Moore
text:
Pelham dog park is a great place to take your pet! It is divided into two areas: one for larger dogs and the other for smaller dogs. There is lots of running room for the gifts, as well as a number of obstacles for them to enjoy. There is also a steady supply of tennis balls from the Pelham Racquet Club!

I have two concerns that cause my review to only have four stars. The first is that there are several low areas that fill up with water when it rains and become mud holes -- they need to be filled. The second is that on our most recent visit (01/23/2021) we noticed that one of the gate locks was broken and needs to be fixed.

name: Boots
text: Decent park, but people need to watch their dogs and pick up after them. A lot of dirt as well, so when it rains it's kind of muddy.

name: Amy Self
text: I loved the activities for the dogs. It would be nice if there were a shaded area for people to sit under. That was the only negative part.

name: Dean Harris
text: Cool, muddy day... Bayleigh loved it!

name: David Wilkins
text: Great dog park.  The little things like high quality bags make this a preferred destination for my fur babies and I

name: Chelsea McCubbin
text: Access to fresh water, fun obstacles, lots of space! It's perfect for when my boys need to run out some energy and I don't want to pay to go hiking at oak mountain.

name: Chris McMahon
text: First time there and it was closed.

name: Phillip Coshatt
text: Great place for a walk with the family

name: purplebananas
text: Nice place to take your pooch to play.😊

name: Dawn Marie
text:
Beautiful and large area for dogs to play.
Disappointed in how many people do not pick up after their dogs.

name: Alyssa Coldren
text: Closed for the month of August

name: JoAnna McClellan
text: Great except for the muddy spots

name: Ken Finch
text: Nice clean park, well maintained and enjoyable for all size dogs!

name: Natalie Babcock
text: Beautiful park with walking trail and clean dog park.

name: Steve Morris
text: Always great and well kept

name: Gloria Wallace
text: It's ok...They have 2 sections..One for big dogs and one for small dogs..Not that big..but ok .

name: Nunya Bzwax
text: Nicely maintained and a pleasant little park. There is a water source, bags and a trash can to put your dogs mess.

name: Scott Breeding
text: This place is great! It's a little place of peace to take your dog out for the day. Not the biggest and not the best but the trees make a good shade and it has a fog eater fountain in the entrance gate area.

name: Meagan Gossett
text: We have been here a few times. Every time the grounds are well kept and clean. We love to take our dog here :).

name: Brenda Hoffman
text: My pups love going

name: Joshua Hoffman
text: Great place to take your dog to run and play..

name: Kim
text: It is good and clean

name: Kellie Hyatt
text: My son loved the skate park

name: kimbolinarino
text: This is a great dog park but not many other people use it often so there are not a lot of dogs to play with! There is an agility course, seperate little dog area, water spickets and dog fountains, a portopotty, doggy bag stations, benches, trees with shaded areas and a large area to run. Quiet neighborhood also.

name: Adam Smith
text: Several good Pokemon Go pokestops

name: Patricia Romero
text: My dogs love going to the park. I'm so glad that Hartselle has a place like this for dogs.

name: Penny McTaggart
text: Great place to take dogs for exercise or socialization

name: Annette Hall
text: It was perfect, our dogs loved being able to run free!!

name: Powers Teague
text: Clean fun place to take your dogs and meet other people and other dogs

name: spider1usa
text: It a very nice place to take your dog

name: Susie Burgess
text: Very nice and roomy, with separate areas for large and small dogs. Water station and plenty of shade!

name: Brittany Hurst
text: Nice area, good grassy space, some trees for shade but almost all the trees have poison ivy all up them. Yes water source and hose.

name: Jennifer Green
text: They have no restroom for the humans to use

name: Mike Moore
text: Pretty nice especially with the new agility course

name: Mary-Joyce Corum
text: The park itself is alright.  It's the people that are not.  It's sad when people bring back their aggressive and nervous dogs to roam off leash and attack other dogs running and playing.

name: Tammy Hudson
text: Love the new agility course

name: James Nichols
text: Good place for dog run.

name: Mike Swafford
text: Dog park is great

name: Andre Baskin
text: I take my dogs here quite often. The fence is secure and most people monitor their dogs nicely. Seems to have more activity later in the afternoon.

name: Lashayle Dodson
text: Simple park. No separation for big and small dogs. I have a toy dog that ran between a gap in the fence. The place is extremely muddy in bad weather. Large dogs mostly visit. I saw a small dog once in a year.

name: Marie Pate
text: Great park with benches for resting. They have an awesome watering fountain for the dogs and the standard dog park double gated entrance for safety. They do need to keep the poopy bags supplied better. They have nice dispensers but there were never any bags in them. We always brought our own so it wasn't a problem for us but it must have been a problem for some dog owners as there was quite a bit of pooh around! That's the only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating. I noticed there weren't many locals using the park and 1 resident said she's lived a few blocks from it for years and just recently discovered it. Dog owner's should really try this park it's great for your pup and you might make a new friend as well!

name: Carey Winkler
text: Good place to run my dog.  Close to my house.   Not too crowded and keep the poop bag dispenser full usually

name: Kriss Payne
text: Clean and simple grassy place to let your dogs out. We went to visit the USS Alabama and found this just down the street. The dogs enjoyed getting some sniffs and running water. No dogs today so we didn't stay long. We walked around the park for a minute then headed home. Not bad for a local park but we will be driving to the nicer parks further south in the future.

name: marlli and me
text: Nice and clean area for my dog to play..I will go back again 👍🏼

name: Seth Purkerson
text: This place was barren, just a fenced in area with a dog friendly water fountain and a bench.

name: Stacey Steiner
text:
I didn't go to dog park. I took children to the park that had a dog park in it. There were no dogs there while I was.
The children had a good time at the park. There were a few other children there. All the children were well behaved, parents all kept an eye on their children and all children shared and got along well.

name: Jennifer Booker
text: We love this dog park. It's big and the people who come are so nice.

name: Libby Cook (Taylor)
text:
Not a huge dog park, but it was clean and plenty enough room for our pup to run around. Only went once and no other dogs were here, so I’m not sure if it’s busy. There’s bags for poop if you forgot yours & a nice fountain that has a spout at dog level.

Downside: no separate area for small/big dogs.

name: Ray Frye
text: Needs drainage work in the dog area.  Other than that.. love it

name: Titus Young
text: Good walking area

name: Hellacious Hustler
text: Beautiful little park, lots of room for my dog to run. Clean and quiet.

name: Michael Cannon
text: The ribs & other foods are very good to me!!

name: Connie Chung
text: It was str8 alot of cute guys or wateva i hope they open the pool back

name: Rick Barron
text: Its also a disc golf course and the two intersect at some point and dog owners let them poop in the fairway,sometimes they get hit by a stray disc.

name: Paula Campbell
text: Great fun for our 4 legged friends! Plenty of running space and pals to make🐕 Water fountain not operational.

name: Charnise McQueen
text: Good park  needs more things the dogs can play in or with . It's just grass .

name: Melissa Oliver
text: Love the dog park. We take our baby there all the time.

name: Johnnie Beach
text: In these COVID-times...this is an outdoor place to come together with your four-legged friends. You can safely social distance while you play with your pets and talk with others!

name: Dustin Bowen
text: Plenty of space in the large breed side, has plenty of doggy bags place around the space, only downside was the water was turned of for them to drink out of.

name: Mandy Foskey
text: It was a recreational park but it was very nice and plenty of area to walk dogs.

name: yobany romero
text: Peaceful  and lots of room to play and train

name: Ira Sivley
text: Always plenty of dogs at the dog park for your dog to play with. Used the large breed park. Good time.

name: Curtis Doolittle
text: Wide open space.

name: Stephen Newell
text: Needs water

name: BJ Johnson
text: Our first dog park.  Nicely set up.  Has both a small and big dog area.  A fenced entry area so dogs can become acquainted before actually entering the play area.  All dogs were fun and friendly except one 🙄.

name: Gabriel Escudero
text: clean, big and well maintain, water for dogs available!

name: kathleen jone
text: Safe and fun for the pup.  Bring your own bags though.  They don’t seem to fill them.

name: Chris Tina Miller
text: They put new grass down. Always a pleasure here.

name: Aryn Tew
text: Great bark park. Usually have four legged friends to play from 3-5 on the week days. There is fresh water for the pups and a separate area for smaller dogs

name: Barton and Marina Johnson
text: Nice spacious fenced areas separate pens for small and large dogs.  Gazebo style seating.

name: Chey Prke
text: It's a nice dog park but I Wish it was maintained better. There is always giant puddle of water at the entrance that dogs pee and poop in it. Not going back since my dog got worms from drinking out of it.

name: Kendra Carter
text: Great park!

name: Thomas Erb
text: Needs some fill dirt where dogs have dug and near the pool.

name: Derek Rogers
text: Only dog park on Fort Rucker. Two fenced areas, one smaller one a lot larger. 2 Cons: 1.Infinite number of gnats and other annoying bugs all summer. 2. Entranceway and other areas get flooded and muddy during times of rain. Be prepared to get covered in mud. Don't bring your Sunday best!! Pros: large enough area for many dogs to play. Gated entranceway to allow easy come and go with dogs that just need to get through that gate right now.  There always seems to be left over "kiddie pools" that you can fill up with the convenient water nozzle. Con 3: water port is outside of the fence area. Anyway,  not a bad place. Have fun!

name: Shamus Ivette Kirschbaum
text: Chopper's favorite place!  Lots of fun to be a dog here.

name: Lina Nekro
text: Dog park is bigger than the one off post. I enjoy bringing my dogs here.

name: James Manning
text: Nice dog park on base

name: The Adventurous Mom
text: Nice park, except nobody could up their dog poop.... so gross.

name: Turo Tales
text: It has water, two fenced in areas, and a place to drop the scooped poop, it's perfect!

name: Steve Crumb
text: Could use some cleaning up at times.

name: Jonathan Bunch
text: Great

name: Sean Giorgianni
text:
The beer is good; the dog park is even better; but the people are the best!

Things are immaculately clean and maintained. The features - pools, ramps, balls, seating, lighting - are the best I’ve ever seen. The beer is tasty and cold and on tap. And, like I mentioned, the people are friendly, helpful, genuine, and hospitable.

I was in the middle of a 20 state road trip. Roxy, my chihuahua, needed a safe place to exercise and work off some anxiety from being on the road for two weeks. And HopHounds took us in and treated us like family!!!

You’re missing out on the gift of love - people and puppies - if y’all don’t try HopHounds.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Sean! We really enjoyed getting to meet you and Roxy! We hope to see you again anytime you're driving through!

name: C C
text: Great place to take our shy little rescuse. She was timid at first but opened right up. Lots of activities to keep the pups busy. Not enough shade for hot days but I heard they are working on that.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, CC! We're so glad to hear that your dog enjoyed herself at the park! We are working to get more shaded area and we are also working to convert the back of our building to an indoor space for the pups to enjoy in any type of weather! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Terry Edeker
text:
As both a customer and a vendor of HopHounds, I experience their Brew Pub and Dog Park from two different perspectives:
As a customer I appreciate the variety of beer and relaxed atmosphere. The recent addition of food was an excellent decision and my hat is off to the chef for creating some delicious treats. It is great witnessing the joy on the dog’s faces as they come to play. Also, I like the variety of events…something for everyone.
As a vendor, I get to know the management and staff and I have to say that they are professional and work very hard at getting to know their customers (dog and parents) with the goal of making their visit an enjoyable one.

HopHounds is a great addition to the Mobile area. Even if you don’t own a dog, visit and experience it for yourself.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Terry!

name: Kathy Jo
text: 10 stars!  My boy literally drags me to HopHounds. The beer selection is one of the best in Mobile, the food is delish and with 2 big screen TVs outside and 1 inside you never miss a game! Bonus: I have a whole new group of friends since discovering this gem.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Kathy! We love having you and James as part of our pack!

name: Half Kimchi
text: Friendly staff. Inexpensive place to spend your time. Definite must for dog lovers whether you have a dog or not.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! We're so happy to hear that you love HopHounds as much as we do. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Ruth Foust
text:
Best idea ever! OMG! I couldn't believe it when I saw it on the map. We were traveling through Alabama and this helped us entertain our dog and grab a bite to eat. Everyone here is incredibly friendly, and the place is spotless. Great service, music, and food. I recommend it 100%!!!
Make sure to bring your pup's vaccination record and then you're ready to play and relax!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Ruth! We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your time at HopHounds!

name: K. Leanne
text:
In late February-early March, I took my dog and met some friends and their dog at HH. The atmosphere is cute, but the beer selection is lacking (add more beer selections than Bud, Corona, and Miller, and seltzers). I love that it's an extremely dog friendly bar&park, but I felt like the rules were not clear enough at some points. The bar seemed too trusting of dogs, and their owners at some points, and too strict at other points. Most places should have rules placed in more than one location. Also, there's no indicator of dogs that are restricted, other than verbal statement.

I was  also not fond of the small portions for their meals for the price I paid. It's a little pricey, but it's still worth visiting at least once.

resp.text:
Hi K. Leanne,

We pride ourselves on having a very wide beer/wine and seltzer selection for our customers. If you have been to our park you know that we offer over 60+ speciality craft beers in addition to several different seltzers, and numerous wines and ciders. To enter our facility, guests are required to sign that they have read and understand our rules. Also, our rules are clearly posted for every patron to see. We have at least 1 Wooferee in the park at all times when dogs are present which supervise dogs play very rigorously at all times. I'm not sure what you are stating about "indicators of which dogs are restricted" as we do not have any breed restrictions. Thanks for visiting and we hope to see you again soon!

name: William Griffith
text: This place is awesome! To actually have a place to sit enjoy a huge selection of beers and have your dogs run free it's amazing

resp.text: Thanks for the review, William! We're happy to hear that you love HopHounds as much as we do!

name: lana pennington
text: I am from Ky ... visiting g Mobile I googled dog parks called and got the info At which point was told I would need my dogs vaccination records which I had emailed to me so it was not a problem. I’m so glad we found this place. What a neat concept! Clean, friendly, even the other guests made me feel welcome! My girl had the best time. We will definitely be back.

resp.text: We're so glad you found us, Lana. I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed your time at the park so much. We look forward to seeing you again next time you’re visiting Mobile!

name: Brett Smith
text: What a great place for dogs to play and socialize with each other. Hophounds is also a great place for the humans with a great beer selection(50+)and wonderful food from Sticks & Stacks. Where else can you go to get energy out of your dog and enjoy great food and beer at the same time. The guidelines for entry were very clear and understandable. Hophounds is a wonderful place and we will return.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Brett! We love having you and Grey as part of our pack!

name: lisi M
text: They are so considerate and thoughtful of all puppies needs. I love this place. Heaven on earth. And they have an amazing selection of beer. Can't go wrong👏👏👏👏

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Lisi! We look forward to see you again soon!

name: Tony Riels
text: Absolutely wonderful! I now know that a "Dog Park" can be done perfectly. Totally classy, fun, and safe! Thank you so much!  "CoCo" loves it.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Tony! We look forward to seeing ya'll again soon!

name: Karen Nelson
text: The bar was closed on Saturday at 5 p.m., even though their google site said they were open.  We walked there, and were super let down to find them closed with no posted notice or posted updated hours.  We know we’re not done with covid and stuff happens, but they should update hours at the least.

resp.text:
Hi Karen. We're so sorry that you walked all the way to the park and we were closed. We were watching the weather all day and they were calling for inclement weather so we decided to stay closed. We did post on our social media profiles that we would be closed, but I'm sorry that we did not update our google account as this type of closure happens fairly quickly. We hope that you give us another chance and we would be happy to give you a free day pass for your visit.

-HopHounds Management

name: Emily Jeanminette
text:
Not sure why anyone would give this place less than a 5 star review. They advertise literally everywhere that you have to have your shot records. That’s common sense anyway because no one wants to hang around a dog that hasn’t had the proper vaccinations in case of a biting incident or exposure to infected fecal matter.

Anyway, fantastic place. They do a great job of keeping the dogs and the people happy.

No business in Mobile like this one.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Emily! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Brandon Wendling
text: Delicious and locally sourced menu. Love the beer selection and atmosphere. Will continue to bring the pups!

resp.text: We're glad to hear you loved the park. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Mark Wolfe
text: We had a great time. We'll be back!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Mark! We look forward to seeing you and Lucy again soon!

name: Chrissie Sumrall
text: Super fun, for our dog and us !!

resp.text: We're glad ya'll had fun, Chrissie! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Carol Mellon
text: Cool place.   Dogs had a great time,  food from the food truck was delicious.

resp.text: We're glad you enjoyed the park and our food truck! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Jason Whiddon
text: Fun place to go drink a beer and relax watching dogs have fun.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Jason!

name: Ivy Berg
text: Beautiful, clean, spacious area.  Great concept and beer selection! Friendly staff.  Can't wait to come back!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Ivy! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Jon Verdugo
text: Dogs and beer. What more do you need?

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Jon! We agree that there is no better combination than dogs and beer!

name: Billy McLeod
text: Staff is great and dogs have lots of fun. Most r well behaved.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Billy! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Tyler B
text: Excellent dog park and bar! Great staff and owner. Highly recommend even if you don't have a dog.

resp.text: Thanks Tyler! We're happy you're a part of our pack!

name: Jessica Wolford
text: Such a great atmosphere and idea. Love it

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Jessica!

name: Chad Pilgrim
text: I don’t really do many reviews but this place deserves the recognition! Awesome place!

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Chad! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Daniel Johnson
text: Thanks for wasting my time.  I drove 45 minutes to come here only to be turned away because I didn't have shot records on me. Who the %*×= has shot records or vet bills ready to show someone.   I get why they might have this policy but it's not like I'm taking my dogs to the vet its a dog park.  I'll just keep going to the public dog park where I won't get turned away or have my time wasted.   Do yourself a favor save the time collecting your pet records and just go to one of the many public dog parks lol.  You can even bring your own beer lol.

resp.text: Hi Daniel. We're sorry you drove so far to be turned away. We do publicly advertise on our website and all social media platforms that shot records are required, and dogs over a year old must also be spayed or neutered to be allowed entry into our facility. We  are sure that you understand that the advantage to bringing your dog to our park is that you are assured that all dogs are vaccinated against common viruses. Our policy is to ensure the safety of all dogs and their owners at our park.

name: sonny b
text: Our 🐕 loved it she played in a pool band busted a soccer ball but we got to see her PLAY

resp.text: We love Delilah! We're happy ya'll are a part of our pack!

name: Andrew Thigpen (Andrew)
text: Fantastic bar with huge outdoor dog park. Friendly staff as well! We will be regulars

resp.text: Thanks for the review Andrew! We're glad to have ya'll!

name: Jojo Rude
text: Friendly staff and good puppies

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Jojo!

name: Scott Jones
text: Good food.  Try the Bao Burger.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Scott!

name: Haley Powell
text: A pathetic excuse and total copycat of a business disgusting

name: Stephanie Otalora
text: Feels like home to my dogs!!

resp.text: Thanks Stephanie! We're happy your dogs found a home here!

name: David Hayes
text: Place rocks.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, David! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Maranda Ziglar
text: Our big boy loves this place. It's a great place for him to run some of his energy out.

name: Jonathan Bryant
text: Great place to take your pets on a quick stop. Just around the corner from McDonald’s

name: Doom Sucker
text: Nice place for our puppy didnt even know this was here

name: Classic Sutton
text: Smh
